Class StmtListNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • StmtListNode

  • public class StmtListNode
extends java.lang.Object
    A statement list constitutes a descartes program (ProgNode), if-then clauses (IfStmtNode), else clauses (ElsePartNode), and loop bodies (LoopNode). 
         1. stmt-list : stmt stmt-tail

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StmtListNode(StmtNode stmt, StmtTailNode stmtTail)
      Builds a new statement list.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void execute(ProgState progState)
      Executes the first statement in the statement list and its statement tail (which executes the next statement, etc.)
      static StmtListNode parseStmtList(TokenReader tokenReader)
      Reads source code tokens from tokenReader and parses them into and returns a statement list.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • StmtListNode

        public StmtListNode(StmtNode stmt,
            StmtTailNode stmtTail)
        Builds a new statement list. Statement lists consist of a statement and a statement tail.
        Parameters:
        stmt - The first statement in the statement list
        stmtTail - Contains the statement that follows the first statement in the statement list

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public void execute(ProgState progState)
             throws DCRuntimeErrorException
        Executes the first statement in the statement list and its statement tail (which executes the next statement, etc.)
        Parameters:
        progState - The current program state
        Throws:
        DCRuntimeErrorException - Thrown in the event of a runtime error (for instance, if a division by zero occurs)

      • parseStmtList

        public static StmtListNode parseStmtList(TokenReader tokenReader)
                                  throws java.io.IOException,
                                         DCSyntaxErrorException
        Reads source code tokens from tokenReader and parses them into and returns a statement list. Statement lists appear in the bodies of programs, if-then clauses, else clauses and loop bodies. When this method is called a statement list is imminently expected.
        Parameters:
        tokenReader - The TokenReader from which source code tokens will be read
        Returns:
        The constructed StmtListNode that was parsed from the source code
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if an error occurs while reading the source code file
        DCSyntaxErrorException - Thrown if a syntax error appears in the source code
